intro: Verbesina rosei, commonly known as the rose verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Verbesina rosei thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens.
